briefdescription.para: Returns the value of a part, considering the value of resources in it. Does not account for recovery loss and Does not account for any crew inside the protopart.
This returns the filename for a craft thumbnail. This is used when saving craft to generate the thumbnail filename, and when loading craft to determine the thumbnail filename to read.

detaileddescription.para: Thumbnail naming pattern: {game name}_{editor type}_{sanitized path}_{shipname}.png Where {sanitized path} is the sub-directory path. Diretory separators are replaced with underscore (_). Path starts with the first directory under the editor directory. For example, Using this path: D: first game stage rockets packages Using this ship name: Science Mission 1 Produces this thumbnail name: "my first game_VAB_one stage rockets_science packages_Science Mission 1.png"

parameterdescription.para: The fully qualified path to the file. Does not include filename.
The name of the craft. Does not include file exension.

briefdescription.para: This returns the filename for a craft thumbnail. This is used when saving craft to generate the thumbnail filename, and when loading craft to determine the thumbnail filename to read.

detaileddescription.para: Thumbnail naming pattern: {game name}_{editor type}_{sanitized path}_{shipname}.png Where {sanitized path} is the sub-directory path. Diretory separators are replaced with underscore (_). Path starts with the first directory under the editor directory. For example, Using this path: D: first game stage rockets packages Using this ship name: Science Mission 1 Produces this thumbnail name: "my first game_VAB_one stage rockets_science packages_Science Mission 1.png"

parameterdescription.para: the folder name of the game directory, e.g., "my game"
the user-created directory tree (starting with the editor) where the craft resides, e.g., "/VAB/rockets/single stage"
the craft name, e.g., "Saturn 5"

briefdescription.para: Returns the path to the ~/saves directory where the saved games are

Returns the fully qualified file system path for the provided game name (use HighLogic.GameName for the current game). E.g., "D:/games/KSP/saves/My game/Ships/VAB/" Omitting the second argument will provide the game's root directory. E.g., "D:/games/KSP/saves/My game/"

Returns the fully qualified file system path for the provided game name (use HighLogic.SaveFolder for the current game). E.g., "D:/games/KSP/saves/My game/Ships/VAB/" Omitting the second argument will provide the game's root directory. E.g., "D:/games/KSP/saves/My game/"
Returns the editor subfolder for the provided facility. E.g., "VAB" or "SPH" Does not return a full path.
Check to see if a craft has the correct version to be loaded by this copy of KSP

parameterdescription.para: Config node containing the details of the ship
Returns a string containing a list of all the errors

simplesect.para: true if the version is compatible, false if not

briefdescription.para: Saves the craft in the provided game directory, under the provided facility, in the provided path, with the provided name.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the game-save folder, e.g., "my game"
the editor that was used to create the craft, e.g., VAB or SPH
the player-created subfolders, e.g., "rockets/single stage"
the craft name, e.g., "Saturn 5"

simplesect.para: The fully qualified path down to the ship name, e.g., "D:/games/KSP/saves/my game/ships/VAB/rockets/single stage"

memberdef.argsstring: (ShipConstruct ship, string landedAt, string displaylandedAt, string flagURL, Game sceneState, VesselCrewManifest crewManifest, bool fromShipAssembly, bool setActiveVessel, bool isLanded, bool preCreate, Orbit orbit, bool orbiting, bool isSplashed)
memberdef.name: AssembleForLaunch

briefdescription.para: Internal only method. Public API should use the static above. Which sets fromShipAssembly, setAtiVessel, isLanded to true. preCreate to false and orbit to null by default. Constructs vessel from shipconstruct and adds to FlightGlobals.

parameterdescription.para: the ShipConstruct
landed string in English
landed string Localized
the flagURL
the Game we are adding to
the crew manifest for the ship
true if coming from the editor scenes, otherwise false. This is passed to Vessel.Initialize
true if we want to set this vessel to the active vessel in the game
true if vessel is landed, otherwise false
true if we want a pre-creation pass to generate a vessel/protovessel will skip adding to flightglobals and a few other things
the orbit for the vessel or null
True if vessel is orbiting situation
True if vessel is splashed on the surface of water
